job_title: Assistant Director in Key Largo, FL
pros:
President who cares
Human Resource department that is on your side
An environment that puts students of all identities first
cons: The Key West and Marathon locations can be difficult to find affordable housing.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Key West, FL
pros: Great students and area to live

review_title: Don't Even Consider Moving to Work Here
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Key West, FL
pros: You can look at the water while you eat lunch. Students are mostly nice. They pay you enough to live very frugally on the islands with one job.
cons: The president has created a culture of cliques and micromanagement. There is a revolving door of employees. They have a SIX MONTH probation period, and they routinely fire people even 5.5 months in even if they have moved across the country for the position and done a stellar job. They do this all the time. They let great people go suddenly for no reason and then promote whomever is standing next to them regardless of qualifications. They exclude people from things like birthday parties like it's high school.  They try to manage employee relationships of which they disapprove in the community; Key West is a very small town, so there's little privacy. HR is unhelpful to both management and staff. It's nearly impossible to live decently in the Keys earning less than $85K/year.

pros: Other faculty are great and most of the staff are very helpful. The student body is very diverse in terms of age and backgrounds.
cons: Heavy workload, but that isn't the real problem. Administration is extremely controlling and antagonistic. Communication is horrendous; people are not informed of important decisions until after they are made. Arbitrary enforcement of made-up rules and norms according to administration whims. If they want to get rid of you, they will find any reason.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Key West, FL
pros: FKCC is a small community college but the students and staff are excellent. My supervisors are really good at make sure my needs are met and the atmosphere is comfortable. This school thrives on customer service and shows it day in and day out.
cons: FKCC is a bit disorganized. Due to the lack of staff this school tries it's best to maintain but ends up burning out some of the best employees. Some faculty members are very questionable. SInce they have been there for a long period of time some feel that the rules don't apply. The rules need to be the same for all.

review_title: Top faculty and staff are "let go," while inexperienced and unprofessional administrators are promoted and given raises.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Key West, FL
pros: It's in Key West, Florida.  Many of the students and faculty are truly wonderful to work with.
cons: Administration positions filled according to "bubba system," rather than credentials or experience.  Faculty have no shared governance.  Students are routinely misadvised, overcharged fees that are not used to support their education (the big ones: lab and distance learning fees), and cannot get help from faculty… since faculty are powerless in the system.

pros: The faculty are dedicated and they care about their classes and their students.
cons: The working environment is horrible. Many good faculty members have lost their position without any warning. Everyone fears they will be next. Lots of good teachers have left as soon as they could find another job, but that meant moving away. Pay is very low and benefits aren't great.

pros: Outstanding facility with a good marine science and underwater education program.
cons: Extremely poor senior administration and clueless management team. Highly political Board of Trustees with no accountability given to management. The Provost does not even have the minimum credentials for the position.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Key West, FL
pros: Florida Keys and Key West...Low student numbers...
cons: Amount of hours required for the pay required. Living Expenses. No chance for fulltime

pros: Other than a close location to Key West, there are no perks that one could think of.
cons:
Horrible and borderline irresponsible/exploitive pay.
Lower level employees treated with a complete lack of respect.
